PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A word of explanation to the person answering this questionnaire.

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces. The extra space or space if there is not sufficient space to answer the questions. Don't hesitate to give details, or describe particular events, if they help to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaires.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires which have been prepared or projected are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

( ) Folklore in Saskatchewan

Preservation of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Office of the Saskatchewan Archives at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our Province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so.

It is quite acceptable to have someone else do the writing at your dictation.

1. Your full name: Dyson P. Armstrong
2. Your address: Regina, Saskatchewan
3. Date: February 14, 1954
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): Bridal Crown, Quebec
5. What was your father's name and occupation?
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year): 1904 - Cashman
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible:
   Portage la Prairie
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child", "I was in my teens", etc).
9. What were your reasons for coming West?
   To farm and make a home by homestead land.
10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information)?
    Government information.

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so. It is quite acceptable to have someone else do the writing at your dictation.

1. Your full name: ARMSTRONG

2. Your address: BIGGAR

3. Date: 7/8/54

4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): British Columbia, Canada

5. What was your father's name and occupation?: Thomas Walton

6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and Year): 1904

7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible:

Portage la Prairie

8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child," "I was in my teens," etc.):

9. What year did you immigrate to Canada?

10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information)?
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?

My father-in-law and myself.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)?

By C.W. train to Saskatoon.

13. What means of transportation did you use?

When drove North third team and democrat.

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.)

Why became trip.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?

Berry Hotel, Saskatoon.

16. Where did you settle or take up land?

S.M. # 22785 R.12 W.3rd. Near where Perdue is.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.

Bryar, Elmoird and took a 160 acre

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came?

Farmer, lumberjack, hunter.

Farmer.
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)?

My father and I traveled.

13. What means of transportation did you use?

By C.P.R. train to Saskatoon.

Then drove North third team and democrat.

14. What incidents of the journey most do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, misadventures or other excitement, etc.)

They became very friendly.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?

Berry Hotel, Saskatoon.

16. Where did you settle or take up land?

Still in 22 135 R.12 West 3rd. Now in 23rd Parallel.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.

Biggar, Elkhorn and back to Biggar.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How after you came?

Timberjack, Thatcher.

Jasmin.
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?

Once a month.

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date and place of marriage.

Married Pearl Smith, Portland

21. Did anyone else come to Sebastopol because of your recommendation? It was a place to settle?

Cousins and parents

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West, tell them how and where they settled.

Parents lived with you.

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to record?

My team of five oxen towed me with the plow through the old and labor, because of this.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (For business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?

Went to church six miles total, then back and demonstrated almost every Sunday, visiting neighbors. At the first pioneer settlement, all came on horseback and on foot.
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date and place of marriage.

Married Pearl Smith

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommendation? If so, where?

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West, tell when they came and where they settled.

23. In any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to record?

My dear old friend Mr. Smith wrote me a letter and told me about his experiences.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (For business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?

Went to church six miles south from here and drove there and back every Sunday.
